attributes.comment:
To Whom It May Concern,
I can say that it was not surprising to hear that rates were increasing as that does
happen due to the rising costs of providing services. I was, however, shocked by
the rate of increase. As an adopting parent, I have already spent an enormous
amount of money and had in my budget for the remaining fees I would need to pay
in order to get my daughters citizenship. I feel that the amount of increase is
unfair and unjust. I see so many people living off the system and those of us
paying into the system are always being expected to pay more. I would at least
hope that all adoptive cases currently in process would be grandfathered in under
the current fees rather than the proposed ones. Unfortunately, a country that
supposedly supports International adoption of orphans seems to make it more
difficult and financially straining to most middle income families. That is a shame.
I hope whomever has a hand in passing this increase also has a conscience.
Thankyou for taking the time to read these comments.
Sincerely,
Correen Jones
WA State

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Coreen A. Jones
